dmca.title: How many Mensa members does it take to know what a parody is?
dmca.body:
Sorry, The letter was an attachment sent in Adobe so I cannot copy it but forwarded a copy to Ms. Seltzer.  

It appears Mensa thinks The Fair Use Act does not protect parody 
of Mensa. We are cartoonists. I think a 6th grader could figure out
we are not trying to pose as members of Mensa. We sell products with this image on it(among 6500 other images) but in no way do we even
TRY to play games.  It is pure and simple parody/satire. I am no Mensa and maybe its better I'm not. At least I have a sense of humor and understand parody.  

I used to respect the organization.  Now it's very very sad.  Too bad.

Here is the evil offending cartoon that has them steaming mad and
ready to sue me. 

http://www.londonstimes.us/toons/cartoons/display.html?image=johann_einstein.jpg
